entry.title: Connecting Patients to Doctors in Real-Time Using Django
entry.summary:
Summary

Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, is to create a system that allows patients to connect to doctors licensed in their state efficiently. How I used Django, Celery, Redis and Websockets to create a real-time matching system for Doctor On Demand.

Help us caption & translate this video!

http://amara.org/v/FNEr/

entry.title: But, why is the admin slow?
entry.summary:
Summary

But, why is the admin slow?

This is the general outline I'm working from so far. I think this could change slightly as I develop the talk, but this outline conveys the general theme.

Introduction and display of basic django-debug-toolbar usage (2 min)

Things the admin does well (3 min)

Makes development very fast For many use cases, it "does the right thing" automatically. For example, modifying the HTML in a callable won't cause new queries. What can sneak up on you (5 min)

Having lots of related items visible in the list view Using list_select_related Overriding queryset for additional select_related and prefetch_related options What to avoid in callables (3 min)

Queries that will be executed on every row The default widgets for many-to-many and foreign key fields (3 min)

What widgets to use to replace the defaults based on how many options you have in your database Custom aggregates in the list view (i.e. custom querysets) (3 min)

When this is a good idea When this is too slow and you need other options More general performance improvements through caching (3-5 min)

Django's caching framework Caching with third-party packages / tools Custom caching with Redis Questions (Remaining time)

entry.title: Delving into the Django Admin
entry.summary:
Description

The admin interface is widely considered a ""killer feature"" of Django. At its most basic, you can just register all your models and be on your way, but there's so much more available within Django's admin. This tutorial takes you step by step through the creation and progressive improvement of an admin interface for a fictional library (all code is publicly available).
